text:
Abdulhussain Abdulredha (15 July 1939 – 11 August 2017), () was a Kuwaiti actor, famous and prominent in the Middle East in particular. Abdulredha is best known for his personality of sarcastic humor that made a mockery of the Arab situation comedy template. He was one of the founders of the Arab theater in 1961 and the National Theatre in 1976, as the year 1984 established a special brigade Theatre Arts.
On 11 August 2017, Abdulredha died in London aged 78.
